case_name: Ruling in the Case of Mr. Samuels and Mr. Minott
outcome_details: Mr. Samuels and Mr. Minott both received sentences of six yearsâ€™ imprisonment before credit for pre-sentence custody.
decision_factors: Aggravating factors included exceeding self-defense by shooting Mr. Bangura.
Mitigating factors included guilty pleas, prospects for rehabilitation, and harsh pre-sentence custody conditions.
summary: Mr. Samuels and Mr. Minott pleaded guilty to manslaughter in relation to the death of Mr. Osman Bangura and were sentenced to six years' imprisonment each, with credits for pre-sentence custody reducing the time remaining. Both offenders' circumstances and the harsh conditions of their pre-sentence custody were considered, along with legal precedents and principles.
